definitions.definition: The act or instance of suppressing .
A process in which a person consciously excludes anxiety-producing thoughts, feelings, or memories.
The entirety of acts aimed at stopping or preventing the enemy to execute such unwanted activities like firing, regrouping, observation or others.
A subconscious adaptation by a person's brain to eliminate the symptoms of disorders of binocular vision such as strabismus, convergence insufficiency and aniseikonia.

main_definition: The act or instance of suppressing .
secondary_definitions: ( psychology ) A process in which a person consciously excludes anxiety-producing thoughts, feelings, or memories.
( military ) The entirety of acts aimed at stopping or preventing the enemy to execute such unwanted activities like firing, regrouping, observation or others.
( of an eye ) A subconscious adaptation by a person's brain to eliminate the symptoms of disorders of binocular vision such as strabismus, convergence insufficiency and aniseikonia.
